message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SE

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper discusses the security and trustworthiness of the Witnet protocol, which involves retrieving and verifying web contents without blindly trusting any third party. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper describes how Witnet runs on a blockchain and uses a network of witnesses to retrieve and deliver web contents for clients. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper introduces a novel 'sharding' feature in the Witnet protocol that ensures the efficiency and scalability of the network. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses how Witnet connects smart contracts to the outer world and retrieves web contents from any web address. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper describes the design and implementation of the Witnet protocol, including how RAD tasks are assigned to witnesses and how clients pay witnesses for their work.
